etymologies: mid 17th century; earliest use found in Henry Cogan (fl. 1652–1653). Originally from Portuguese balão, †ballaam; in later use partly reborrowed from French balon, †ballon long, oared boat of south-east Asia

definitions: In parts of South and South-East Asia, especially Siam (now Thailand): a long and richly decorated state barge propelled by oars.
